title: DPM/FM leaves for KSA to participate in OIC-FMs meeting
content:
ISLAMABAD, Nov 09 (APP): Deputy Prime Minister/Foreign Minister Senator Mohammed Ishaq Dar on Saturday left for the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia where he would participate in the meeting of Foreign Ministers of the Organization of Islamic Cooperation (OIC) in Riyadh.
“The Deputy Prime Minister/Foreign Minister will also be part of the Pakistan delegation led by Prime Minister Muhammad Shehbaz Sharif at the second Arab-Islamic Summit. Convened at the initiative of the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia, the Summit will consider the situation in the Middle East, including the ongoing Israeli aggression against Palestine,” Ministry of Foreign Affairs posted on X.
